column4: I have a problem with ubuntu on my laptop. My laptop has an "Intel Graphics Media Accelerator 950" graphics card and Linux finds it automatically and picks a driver for it. All sorts of cool effects work, except for certain glitches, like horizontal line artifacts in specific places on my screen. They go away if move a window over them or drag a selection box over them but they come back in a while.
If I can't fix this problem it'll be a deal breaker and I'll have to go back to Windows and I don't want to do that.
card is not quite compatible, some cards dont work sowell, you're the lucky winner of one of them
sometimes you can disable certain effects,wobbly windows is good for causing artifacts
the problems still happen with all effects off
and you can always just disable the effects
could it also be caused by some problem with me using an external display for my laptop? I have the main display disabled and the external display is the default.
unlikely
What can I do if turning off all the effects still causes me problems?
not all onboard cards run effect well, although im surprised a intel doesnt, i thought most of those worked
you may wanna check how much ram is dedicated to the card in bios, what kinda machine is it
shouldnt really be having alot of problems with that machine, is it set to 128mb shared?
you may want to try it off of the external monitor just to see, if it works, then its just remediating why the external is funky

I've had nothing but problems with display on my laptop. Compiz has problems detecting my true resolution so I have to set it manually and the dimming effect when it asks for my sudo password when I install stuff doesn't dim the whole screen like it's detecting the wrong resolution.
